title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: — A good road conducted us, by the ruins ofLeuchars Castle, through an open and cultivatedcountry, only enlivened by the woods of St. Ford onour left ; soon after passing which, the noble estuaryof the Tay was seen to intervene between us and theCarse of Gowrie, backed by the serrated ridges of theSidlaw hills ; while, at the foot of " the Law," " Bonny Dundee," with its huge steeple, manufactories,vUlas, and harbour, showed ample title to its ancient and endearing appellation.
